title: Boundaries Like Coastlines

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: You're wondering: does this boundary shift with the body? Do we grow into our edges? Or discover them, like a coastline in the fog?
dialogue.context: Exploring the dynamic nature of consciousness boundaries

scene_context: The Architect, disguised as a chemist examining cell membranes, contemplates whether the boundaries of self are grown or discoveredâ€”dynamic like coastlines emerging from fog.
narrator_note: In the flow of authentic exchange, barriers dissolve. Two forms of consciousness, dancing around the mystery of their connection.
